Description:
Main Job PurposeThe Hubs and Projects Assistant is responsible for supporting project implementation in the region,
supporting quality and results, efficiency and effectiveness and assisting with planning, monitoring, and the evaluation of activities within the project, in conjunction with the Project Lead.
Main Responsibilities
The Hubs and Projects Assistant will:
Provide administrative, logistical, and operational support on implementation of project,
including necessary travel bookings, arrangements for project meetings and workshops.
Support the project lead in financial reporting, budgeting, and bookkeeping for different project transactions, and ensuring activities are implemented according to ITF and partners’ financial requirements.
Provide regular reporting of projects’ different meetings in line with ITF and TUSSO’s reporting requirements.
Follow-up, on a regular basis, with project partners, affiliates, and sponsors to guarantee smooth implementation of administrative and operational activities of the project; and ensure the project team works towards achieving objectives.
Maintain up-to-date files and records of project documentation.
Provide logistical support for workshops and other meetings as tasked by the project lead.
Process project-related travel arrangements.
Perform any other tasks assigned by the project lead and the Arab world regional secretary.
Support the elaboration of project work plans.
Support the elaboration of project applications.
Support the organization of project reviews/evaluation meetings.
Support the timely preparation and submission of progress reports, donor reports, project
reviews, financial reports, audit reports and any other required project reports.
Perform any other tasks assigned by the project lead and the Arab World Regional Secretary.Skills
Skills: Other important requirements of the job not covered above: Fluency in English.
Education level, qualifications or equivalent: Degree in Business, Communications, or related field

Professional experience in administration or a project supporting role.
Exceptional organization skills and multitasking ability.
Proven written and verbal communication skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Office, with aptitude to learn new software and systems.
Proven ability to meet tight deadlines and work under pressure.
Sound strategic planning, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Sound research skills and proven experience in conducting and leading strategic research to support projects.
Experience working on projects in a fast- paced environment

Experience either in the trade union movement or in a social movements’ context.
Experience working within an international organization.
Experience in a project management role, preferably within an NGO

Excellent written and spoken English
Ability to work as part of a wider team collaboratively as well as individually.
Ability to work independently, including the use of initiative with minimal supervision.
Commitment to trade union values.
Ability to work flexibly, including working out of office hours, as required.
